    • Constructor Detail

      • MonologFXButton

        public MonologFXButton()
        Default constructor for a MonologFX button. Plain button, no label or icon and no default or cancel designation(s).

    • Method Detail

      • setType

        Sets the type of this button.
        Parameters:
        type - MonologFXButton.Type designation.
        See Also:
        MonologFXButton.Type

      • getLabel

        public java.lang.String getLabel()
        Returns the appropriate button label according to the following rules: If the developer specifies a label, it returns that text. If not, the button checks for a resource with i18n (internationalization) text to use for this type of button. If it finds the file and the key corresponding to this button type, it returns the i18n value. If none of the above conditions are met, it returns default text.
        Returns:
        label String consisting of the button's text.

      • setLabel

        public void setLabel(java.lang.String label)
        Sets the label text for the button. To assign a shortcut key, simply place an underscore character ("_") in front of the desired shortcut character.
        Parameters:
        label - String consisting of the desired button text.

      • getIcon

        public javafx.scene.Node getIcon()
        Returns the graphic file (if one is assigned) for this button.
        Returns:
        icon Node consisting of the button's graphic element.

      • setIcon

        public void setIcon(java.lang.String iconFile)
        Sets the graphic for use on the button, either alone or with text. Graphic format must be .png, .jpg (others?) supported by ImageView.
        Parameters:
        iconFile - String containing the location and name of a graphic file (.png, .jpg) for use as an icon on the button face.
        See Also:
        <code>ImageView</code>

      • isDefaultButton

        public boolean isDefaultButton()
        Indicates if this button is designated as the "default" button.
        Returns:
        defaultButton Boolean.

      • setDefaultButton

        public void setDefaultButton(boolean defaultButton)
        Designates this button as the "default" button - or not.
        Parameters:
        defaultButton - Boolean.
